history.content:
HI there

  • The department does not have a policy regarding when students must declare, the college manages that. Although they like students to declare their first semester, they typically block students once they reach 90 units and are undeclared. They also had a blocking-like process for undeclared students at 75 units in the old system, but IDK if that's still the case.
  • Keep in mind that if you delay declaration, you will also delay preferred enrollment in the upper divisions. If you're graduating in two years, this would mean only having priority enrollment for your last semester.
  • Yes, you could choose to delay CS 61B until the summer, however keep in mind that the course will move much quicker. If you take your last pre-req in summer you would submit your application during that term. It would be due Aug 15

children.subject: Hmmm, I think you can still get at least a B+ in CS 61B though, and you are presumably on track with a B for CS 70 if you continue getting at least average score on the exams. A and B+ and B should be able to declare

history.content: I am a junior transfer student and want to double CS major in L&S. I got an A in 61A last semester. However, I did poorly in the first midterm of both 70 and 61B in this semester. One is median and the other is even one standard deviation below mean. I am wondering whether transfer students must complete their technical prerequisites and apply for the major at the end of this semester? Can I take drop one of two classes and take it in the summer? Does it affect my application? Thanks in advance!
history.subject: junior transfer student declare policy
